ddress"}],"name":"isAssetAllowed","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"subscriber","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"nonce","type":"uint256"}],"name":"isNonceUsed","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"role","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"callerConfirmation","type":"address"}],"name":"renounceRole","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"role","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"}],"name":"revokeRole","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes4","name":"interfaceId","type":"bytes4"}],"name":"supportsInterface","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"newWaitPeriod","type":"uint256"}],"name":"updateWithdrawalWaitPeriod","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdrawalWaitPeriod","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The d4a65a30d04b56aba3130fe078d6bc3a27e909","dweb:/ipfs/QmYsXHTrn7PhvdV2QBqiC7mDnBPgpFAcPjMAKRWkkJgXBR"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0xaf28a975a78550e45f65e559a3ad6a5ad43b9b8a37366999abd1b7084eb70721","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b7bd24e224f67f65bfadf85dc2929fa965456bb2415478bd0125471b5ce35245","dweb:/ipfs/QmRaydGr8BTHs1kvaZfsNU69pKzUAGFrvABn1KiRSbE51y"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/ERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6fac27fb1885a1d9fd2ce3f8fac4e44a6596ca4d44207c9ef2541ba8c941291e","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2079378abdb36baec15c23bc2353b73a3d28d1d0610b436b0c1c4e6fa61d65c9","dweb:/ipfs/QmVZkRFMzKW7sLaugKSTbMNnUBKWF3QDsoMi5uoQFyVMjf"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc859863e3bda7ec3cddf6dafe2ffe91bcbe648d1395b856b839c32ee9617c44c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://a9d5417888b873cf2225ed5d50b2a67be97c1504134a2a580512168d587ad82e","dweb:/ipfs/QmNr5fTb2heFW658NZn7dDnofZgFvQTnNxKRJ3wdnR1skX"]},"src/Payments.sol":{"keccak256":"0x653f2c0606629502777ffc44b6b6a55cdd1bee095e25e1cfad5b56113f5fcbd6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2caec170120ef5a1ee2215b4bf549bce2ea2430e5e4fc02c1ef52eb15bb74de3","dweb:/ipfs/QmWwQorQgwkcq9KQTf1QsFZ5fszU4qgozhWwGZYtFCEZ9b"]}},"version":1}

params.asset: - The asset for which the withdrawal request was submitted.
- The asset belonging to caller's account whose balance we're checking.
- The asset belonging to the subscriber's account.
params.subscriber: - The subscriber whose balance we're checking.

checkWithdrawalRequest(address,address).details: If the value is zero (0) then there's no open request.

params.subscriber: - Subscriber whose requests we are checking.

params.amount: - The amount of the given asset being claimed.
params.asset: - The address of the asset being claimed.
params.nonce: - The nonce index number for this interaction.
params.signature: - The subscriber's signature on the aforementioned parameters (as well as the provider who gets to claim).

params.asset: - The asset for which the withdrawal request was submitted.

params.amount: - The amount of the given asset to be deposited via ERC20 transfer.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.asset: - The asset for which the withdrawal request will be submitted.
- The specified asset for which to check allowed status.

params.subscriber: - The subscriber whose nonces we're checking.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.newWaitPeriod: - The new wait period for withdrawals.

allowAsset(address).notice: Allow a specified asset to be used in Semaphore transactions.

cancelWithdrawal(address).notice: Subscribers can use this method to cancel a withdrawal request.

checkBalance(address).notice: Check the sender's balance for a given asset.

checkBalance(address,address).notice: Check a given subscriber's balance for a given asset.

checkWithdrawalRequest(address,address).notice: Anyone can call this method to check the timestamp of withdrawal requests submitted. Providers should use this before initiating (or continuing) a state channel session to check whether they should pull support for a given asset for a given subscriber.

claim(uint256,address,uint256,bytes).notice: Providers use this method to close out a state channel interaction with a given subscriber. The subscriber's address is derived from their signature, which indicates approval for the provider withdrawal.

completeWithdrawal(address).notice: Subscribers who have initiated a withdrawal and waited for the set withdrawalWaitPeriod can complete the withdrawal with this method. All remaining funds in the account will be drained and transferred to the subscriber (the caller).

deposit(address,uint256).notice: Subscribers use this method to deposit allowed assets into their account. Callers should have already approved this contract for the deposit amount. Funds are spent via state channel redemptions in the claim() method.

disallowAsset(address).notice: Disable an asset that was previously allowed.

initiateWithdrawal(address).notice: Subscribers call this method to initiate a withdrawal from their account. The withdrawal will be for the full amount remaining when completeWithdrawal() is called. Any in-flight state channels will still be able to be closed out by the provider using claim().

isAssetAllowed(address).notice: Check if usage of a given asset is enabled.

isNonceUsed(address,uint256).notice: Check if a given nonce for a given subscriber has already expired.

updateWithdrawalWaitPeriod(uint256).notice: Update the designated withdrawal wait period. Required to be greater than the minimum.

documentation.text:
@notice Allow a specified asset to be used in Semaphore transactions.
 @param asset - The asset to be enabled.

@notice Disable an asset that was previously allowed.
 @param asset - The asset to be disabled.

@notice Check if usage of a given asset is enabled.
 @param asset - The specified asset for which to check allowed status.

@notice Check the sender's balance for a given asset.
 @param asset - The asset belonging to caller's account whose balance we're checking.

@notice Subscribers can use this method to cancel a withdrawal request.
 @param asset - The asset for which the withdrawal request was submitted.

@notice Split a signature into a 3-tuple of v, r, s parts/coordinates.
 @param signature - The signature from which to derive v, r, s.
